com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.vector

Class VectorAllele<G extends VectorGene>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.core.Allele<G>
            • com.ojcoleman.europa.algos.vector.VectorAllele<G>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NEATAllele

    public class VectorAllele<G extends VectorGene>
extends Allele<G>

    Class for Alleles represented by a vector of (double precision) floating-point values.

    Sub-classes must implement a copy-constructor that accepts a single parameter which is the allele to copy, and which should generally just call super() with the allele to copy. See com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase#Prototype(PrototypeBase).

    Author:
    O. J. Coleman
    See Also:
    Vector

    • Field Detail

      • vector

        public final Vector vector
        The vector stored by this allele. The values are Vector.mutable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VectorAllele

        public VectorAllele(Configuration config)
        PrototypeBase constructor. See com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase#Prototype(JsonObject).

      • VectorAllele

        public VectorAllele(VectorAllele<G> prototype)
        Copy constructor. See com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase#Prototype(PrototypeBase). Create a new VectorAllele referencing the same underlying Gene but storing an independent copy of the Vector in the original allele.
        Parameters:
        paramVector - The vector for the new allele, copied by reference.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Vector is not set as mutable.

      • VectorAllele

        public VectorAllele(VectorAllele<G> prototype,
            G gene,
            Vector paramVector)
        Copy constructor. See com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase#Prototype(PrototypeBase). Create a new VectorAllele with the specified underlying Gene and storing the specified Vector.
        Parameters:
        allele - The allele to copy.
        gene - the underlying gene for the new allele.
        paramVector - The vector for the new allele, copied by reference.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Vector is not set as mutable.

      • getAllValuesAsMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getAllValuesAsMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> map)
        Get the values from this allele and its underlying gene as a map from the vector element labels to their values.
        Parameters:
        map - The map to put the parameters in. This is emptied before putting the parameters in.

      • difference

        public double difference(VectorAllele<?> other,
                boolean normalise)
        Returns the sum of the absolute differences between corresponding values in this and the given VectorAllele, ignoring the "typeReference" parameter if present.
        Parameters:
        other - The VectorAllele to get the difference from.
        normalise - Whether the difference for each element should be normalised to a unit range, and the sum of the differences should be normalised to a unit range.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If this and the given VectorAllele have different Vector metadata.

      • getStringableMap

        public void getStringableMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
        Description copied from interface: Stringable
        Populate the given map, which is typically to be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object). When overriding this method in a sub-class the super-class implementation should usually be called from the overriding implementation.
        Specified by:
        getStringableMap in interface Stringable
        Overrides:
        getStringableMap in class Allele<G extends VectorGene>
        Parameters:
        map - Mapping from descriptive labels to Objects that can be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object).
